title: What to know about the viral surrogacy lawsuit
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Cindy Bi, a San Francisco venture capitalist, sued surrogate Rebecca Smith following a miscarriage, accusing her of killing the child.
The surrogacy arrangement escalated into a legal battle with harassment, forcing Smith to change jobs and relocate for safety.
Surrogacy industry growth faces regulatory issues; Bi didn't disclose family medical history impacting pregnancy, according to Wired.

title: A healthy Hampus Lindholm could change Bruins’ fortunes in several areas
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returns to the Bruins healthy after missing 65 games last season due to a fractured patella.
Lindholm aims to boost the Bruins' defense and power play, which ranked 29th in the NHL last year.
Lindholm's presence is expected to stabilize the Bruins, who struggled to a 33-39-10 record last season.

title: Drake Maye receives a ringing endorsement from Bills QB Josh Allen
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bills QB Josh Allen praises Patriots' QB Drake Maye, highlighting his arm strength and mobility.
Maye will face Allen in Weeks 5 and 15 this season, marking key matchups.
Maye, drafted third in 2024, aims to help New England improve following a season-opening loss to the Raiders.

title: MBTA debuts train design to honor historic New England railroad, with more on the way
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: MBTA debuts a Boston and Maine Railroad-themed train with maroon and yellow design for the Commuter Rail.
Two more trains honoring New Haven and New York Central Railroads will be introduced by the end of the year.
The refurbished trains come with upgraded systems including remote monitoring, cameras, and modern brake controls.

title: Patriots could be facing off against their former 1st-round pick in Miami
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Former Patriots lineman Cole Strange signed by Miami Dolphins from Browns’ practice squad.
Strange played 29 games for Patriots, released after injuries and poor performance.
Dolphins need reinforcements after guard James Daniels injured in Week 1.

title: Tufts to go tuition-free for families making less than $150K
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tufts University will offer tuition-free education to undergraduates from families with annual incomes below $150,000 starting next fall.
Families earning under $60,000 will receive additional financial aid packages without student loans, covering full tuition costs at Tufts.
The initiative, funded by donor contributions, seeks to increase geographic diversity and reduce tuition worries for students.

title: Aunt now caring for child of parents killed in Watertown murder-suicide
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: David Minasvand, 31, killed Nadia Abrahamian, 80, and Karine Asatryan, 35, in a Watertown murder-suicide.
1-year-old Madeline, daughter of Minasvand and Asatryan, will be cared for by her aunt, as fundraising efforts continue.
Over $37,000 has been raised to support Madeline's needs and honor Karine's memory after the tragedy.

title: What Don Sweeney said about the Bruins’ playoff odds, timeline for new captain
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins GM Don Sweeney expects Boston to be competitive in the upcoming season, despite roster changes and past struggles.
David Pastrnak and Charlie McAvoy are candidates for Bruins captain, but no timeline is set for choosing a new leader.
Sweeney emphasizes opportunities for younger players to secure roles, as competition intensifies for roster spots.

title: These 5 New England restaurants make best 50 list from NYT
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Five New England restaurants made the New York Times' 50 best list, including two from Boston.
Boston's McGonagle's and La Padrona were highlighted, showcasing Irish and Italian cuisines, respectively.
Maine's Pilgrim’s Inn and Sammy’s Deluxe, and Connecticut's Haring’s also featured, no Rhode Island spots included.

title: Patriots reportedly cut ‘training camp star’ DJ James
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots waive second-year cornerback DJ James after a standout preseason performance, per NFL Media's Tom Pelissero.
DJ James, originally a sixth-round pick by Seattle, played two defensive snaps in the Patriots' loss to Las Vegas.
Patriots' cornerback depth affected by injuries, with key players missing game against the Raiders.
